<div class="custom_html tourIB1">
<div class="proGall"><img decoding="async" src="/wp-content/uploads/2023/03/uttar-pradesh-tour.jpg" alt="Best of Uttar Pradesh Tour Package" title="Best of Uttar Pradesh Tour Package" width="750" height="450" loading="lazy"></div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB2">
<div class="tour-overview">
<div class="toBt"><i class="fa fa-file"></i> Tour Overview</div>
<p>Are you planning a trip where you can attain the spiritual, adventurous, and heritage-rich experience? If yes, then browse our beautifully designed Best of Uttar Pradesh Tour Package. This 12 nights and 13 days long tour let you explore each and every beauty of the state and helps you enjoy the wonders of the place to the utmost level.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="custom_html tourIB4">
<div class="tour-collection">
<h2 class="tourDBox"><i class="fa fa-bus" aria-hidden="true"></i> Best of Uttar Pradesh Tour Itinerary Package</h2>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details" id="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 1 :</span>Delhi – Varanasi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="">
<p>Upon arrival in Delhi, our tour representative will greet you and then escort you to the airport to catch the flight to Varanasi. Upon your arrival at the Varanasi Airport, the representative will pick you and assist you in transferring to the pre-listed hotels. Later in the afternoon, get ready and come out of the hotel to explore some of the most important and famous temples in Varanasi. Today you will be visiting the popular temples like Tulsi Birla Manas Temple, Mother India Temple, Hanuman Temple, Sankat Mochan Temple, and also the newly built Vishwanath Temple. Also, participate in the grand evening Ganga Aarti ceremony at the popular Dashashwamedh Ghat. This is all for today so return to the hotel for dinner and then overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 2 :</span>Varanasi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Wake up little early today and get ready for enjoying the boat ride in the holy River the Ganges and then proceed towards exploring all the bathing Ghats. Walk through the narrow lanes of the city and also perform the special puja rituals organized at the ghats. Varanasi Ghats are pretty popular for organizing Pind Daan performed to pay respect to your forefathers. After performing the puja rituals return to the hotel for the morning meal. After enjoying the scrumptious breakfast, proceed towards Sarnath. After the completion of a fun-filled day excursion, return to the hotel for the delectable night meal which will then be followed by a relaxing overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 3 :</span>Varanasi – Vindhyachal – Prayagraj</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post breakfast, you will drive towards Allahabad and on the way to Allahabad, make a halt at Vindhyachal. After reaching the destination, take a holy dip into the Sangam and explore those places popular for religious and historical significance. After exploring the places, you will be transferred to the pre-booked hotel in Allahabad for a relaxing overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 4 :</span>Prayagraj – Chitrakoot – Prayagraj</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After enjoying the breakfast, set out of the hotel and move towards the next destination of the trip, Chitrakoot. On reaching Chitrakoot, explore the popular places of the city and then drive back to Allahabad from where you will depart for Lucknow. By the time you reach Lucknow, it will be dark so you will be transferred to the hotel for dinner and then overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 5 :</span>Lucknow</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After coming out of the hotel, set out of the hotel for enjoying the sightseeing tour in new as well as ancient Varanasi. Explore Chhota Imambara, Bada Imambara, Constantia House, Residency, Rumi Darwaza, Hazrat Ganj, Ambedkar Park, and Chattar Manzil. Later completing the day exploration, return to the hotel for the scrumptious night meal which is then followed by an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 6 :</span>Lucknow – Dewa Sharif – Ayodhya – Lucknow</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After savoring yourself with the hearty breakfast, drive towards Ayodhya. On the way to Ayodhya, visit Dewa Sharif which represents the beautiful symbiosis of love and brotherhood. After this, continue driving towards Ayodhya and after reaching the religious destination, head towards Sri Ram Janm Bhoomi – where the great Hindu Lord Rama took birth. Also, visit the famous Sarayu ghats and Hanuman Garhi. After visiting the place, drive back to Lucknow in the evening for dinner and overnight halt in the hotel.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 7 :</span>Lucknow – Naimisharanya – Dudhwa National Park</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post enjoying the hearty breakfast at the hotel in Lucknow, drive towards Naimisharanya which is the next destination of your journey. After paying homage at the shrines of Naimisharanya, hit the road towards Dudhwa National Park. This huge national park is home to exotic species of animals including tigers, crocodiles, wild elephants, rhinos, and approx.. 450 species of birds. After exploring this gorgeous national park, drive towards the hotel to enjoy the night meal followed by an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 8 :</span>Dudhwa National Park</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Start your little morning as you will be exploring the huge Dudhwa National Park and enjoy the jungle elephant ride. Spot various wildlife species and also track the various species of tigers here and then drive back to the guest house for enjoying the morning and then the afternoon meal. Also, enjoy walking along with the atmosphere or bird watch and then drive back to the jungle and witness the rhinos from the giant watchtower. Return to the guest house for dinner and a relaxing overnight halt.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 9 :</span>Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After enjoying the breakfast, get ready to complete a 2 hrs. driving distance and almost 110 kilometers. Upon arrival at this gigantic wildlife sanctuary, enjoy the boat ride and spot the Gangetic Dolphin, birds, Gharials, and crocodiles. After exploring the beauty of this wildlife sanctuary, drive towards your pre-booked hotel and stay there for the whole night.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 10 :</span>Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary – Lucknow</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>Post enjoying the mouth-watering morning meal, drive towards Lucknow. You will be reaching there by afternoon and on reaching there you will be transferred to the pre-booked hotel. Check-into the hotel, enjoy the lunch and then relax for a few hours. Later in the evening, go out for shopping in Aminabad for Chicken market. After completing your shopping, return to the hotel for dinner followed by a relaxing overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 11 :</span>Lucknow – Agra</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After savoring yourself with the scrumptious morning meal, come out of the hotel and drive towards Agra. On reaching there, check into the pre-booked hotel and stay there for an overnight stay.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 12 :</span>Agra</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>After completing your breakfast you will be taken for the complete sightseeing trip. Today you will be exploring Taj Mahal one of the seven wonders of the world and also the popular Agra Fort. Later in the afternoon, drive towards Fatehpur Sikri to explore the popular Buland Darwaza and then after completing the fun-filled day return to the hotel for a night halt.</p>
</div>
</div>
<div class="TourList">
<div class="TourDates">
<p class="TourDay_details"><span class="TourDay">Day 13 :</span>Agra – Mathura – Vrindavan – Delhi</p>
</div>
<div class="TourInfo" style="display: none;">
<p>On the final day of your journey, drive towards Mathura and Vrindavan and visit the popular Braj Bhoomi. After exploring the popular leftover destinations of the trip, head towards Delhi and spend your overnight stay in Delhi or you can also opt to fly back towards your home. This is how your heritage and adventure tour of Uttar Pradesh ends here with plenty of unforgettable memories.</p>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="custom_html tourIB8">
<div id="popularBox8" class="tour-collection">
<h3><i class="fa fa-question-circle" aria-hidden="true"></i> FAQs for Uttar Pradesh Package</h3>
<div class="panel-body">
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Why Is Uttar Pradesh Well-Known For Tourism?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> It is also home to the Taj Mahal, India's most visited site, and Varanasi, Hinduism's holiest city. Kathak, one of India's eight classical dance forms, originated in Uttar Pradesh. Because Uttar Pradesh is located in the heart of India, it is also known as The Heartland of India.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> When Is The Best Time To Travel To Uttar Pradesh?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> The winters are pleasant and would provide an ideal climate for travelling in this area. Winter months are October to March, and you can plan your Uttar Pradesh vacation during this time.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Which City In Uttar Pradesh Receives The Most Visitors?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Varanasi, also known as Kashi and Banaras, is considered the world's oldest living city and is one of the most popular tourist destinations in Uttar Pradesh.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> Why Do People Want To Come Back To Agra?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> One of the top reasons to visit Agra is to see the Taj Mahal. This city also contains architectural monuments such as Agra Fort and Fatehpur Sikri, both of which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The Mughal influences can be seen in the structures, cuisine, architecture, and shopping.</p>
</p></div></div></div>
<div itemscope="">
<div class="click_ques" itemprop="name"><span>Q.</span> What Is The Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary Well-Known For?</div>
<div class="ans_sec" style="overflow: hidden; display: none;">
<div itemprop="text">
<p><span>A.</span> Its fragile Terai ecosystem is made up of Sal and teak forests, lush grasslands, swamps, and wetlands. It is home to endangered species such as the Gharial, Tiger, Rhino, Gangetic Dolphin, Swamp Deer, Hispid Hare, Bengal florican, white-backed and long-billed vultures.</p>
</p></div></div></div></div></div>
</div>
</div>
